column3: Might be another one of those issues where the tests assume too much of the system they run on? (#21682)
Pinging @practicalswift, this test was committed on March 19, 2021 in 732c7bddeb9.

First, thanks a lot for reporting this @ssb402 :)

What you've found is the combination of two bugs: one bug in macOS and one bug in Bitcoin Core.

* macOS bug: In older versions of macOS Apple engineers simply got IPv6 zero compression wrong. More specifically they missed the sentence `The symbol "::" MUST NOT be used to shorten just one 16-bit 0 field` in RFC 5952. Luckily this issue has

Thanks @practicalswift for the review and explaining the details so clearly!  I appreciate it.\n\nYes, I will review and use the patch from #21756 and see if it resolves my issue.  Then I can create an issue documenting this and discard my PR.
@practicalswift #21756 resolved my issue. Thanks! I will close this PR. Also, created an issue #21967 in case other macOS devs run into this problem.
